pageContext.claim: “Mr. Prime Minister, I want to begin by congratulating you once again on your tremendous victory in Italy. It was something that all the world was watching, and it excited the people all across Italy and, I can tell you, all across the United States, as well.”
pageContext.analysis:
Giuseppe Conte didn’t actually “win” any election, as anyone familiar with European/Italian politics would know. Conte didn’t even run in the election. He was nominated to be Prime Minister by the two populist parties - the Five Star Movement and the League - after the Italian parliamentary election.
Prior to the nomination, Conte was literally unknown to politics.
